subject: JUnit 4 integration with other tools/ides
msgSnippet: I am deciding whether to push JUnit 4 or 3.8 with our group.  The last notes I can find on the JUnit site bemoan the fact JUnit4 has not been integrated into
messageBody:
I am deciding whether to push JUnit 4 or 3.8 with our group. The last
notes I can find on the JUnit site bemoan the fact JUnit4 has not been
integrated into any IDEs or test and build tools yet. However that
was over a year ago. Any update on this? I would be particularly
interested in:

Eclipse
Netbeans
IntelliJ
Cruise Control
Fitnesse
JSystem
maven
cactus

Other build/test tools for Database (oracle), JBoss, Echo2, etc.

Based on the recent posts I saw with someone else concerning DBUnit,
it seems I should still stick with 3.8...?

Robert Kuropkat

P.S. A short "you're screwed" or "actually works but you must still
use JUnit4TestAdapter" answer is fine. Mainly looking for a confidence
level here...
